metadata.Title: CVE-2022-27227 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
In PowerDNS Authoritative Server before 4.4.3, 4.5.x before 4.5.4, and4.6.x before 4.6.1 and PowerDNS Recursor before 4.4.8, 4.5.x before 4.5.8,and 4.6.x before 4.6.1, insufficient validation of an IXFR end conditioncauses incomplete zone transfers to be handled as successful transfers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-27227` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-recursor - 4.7.2-1
No subscription required

pdns-backend-bind - 4.6.3-1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.6.3-1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.6.3-1
pdns-backend-lmdb - 4.6.3-1
pdns-backend-lua2 - 4.6.3-1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.6.3-1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.6.3-1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.6.3-1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.6.3-1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.6.3-1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.6.3-1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.6.3-1
pdns-ixfrdist - 4.6.3-1
pdns-server - 4.6.3-1
pdns-tools - 4.6.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns-recursor package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.7.2-1').
pdns package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.6.3-1').
